remarks: An inhabited class is nonempty.  Following the Definition of [Bauer], p. 483, we call a class ` A ` nonempty if ` A =/= (/) ` and inhabited if it has at least one element.  In classical logic these two concepts are equivalent, for example see Proposition 5.17(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 20.  This version of ~ n0r requires only that ` x ` not be free in, rather than not occur in, ` A ` .  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 31-Jul-2018.)
